review: We received friendly service but our orders weren't accurate.  Which lead to half of us eating, while the others just sat and watched.  The food tasted fresh and delicious.  They have a new expanded lunch menu.  I had the lunch chicken fajitas. It's $8, comes with a starter...I had the soup, but no rice or beans, and no guacamole.

3.5. Chillis is what you expect, service is slow most of the time & the food isn't exceptional but it's a good place to come out with friends and pair up for the 2 for $22. I always get the chipotle chicken crispers from here and substitute the corn on the cob for mash potatoes. Not bad.
Lunch menu is great. Customer service has definitely improved in the last couple months.

Gave Chile's a try the other night after a fairly long absence and was pleasantly surprised. The new menu is paired down to a selection of favorites which is a good thing. I had the guacamole burger and was not disappointed. The burger was ample and the fries pretty darn tasty! If you haven't been here in a  while you owe it to yourself to try it one more time.

Came here on a Thursday night for a family night out... we preferred to sit away from crowds because we have a toddler who loves to talk, laugh, and some times screams when he doesn't get what he wants. Luckily, they had some tables in a corner away from everyone else. (+1 star for accommodating us). The food (+1 star).... -Our waiter brought us a few dirty plates for our appetizers. When I said dirty, I mean it has grease from food left on it and food stuck to it. Yuck! My kids refused to use the plates - couldn't blame them as I wouldn't either. -Our steak came out dried, so dried that my 11 year old didn't want to finish his steak. We had requested for his steak to be medium well done, it came out well done. -The second steak plate - the broccoli was overlooked. Couldn't tell if it was burnt in the oven or how it was cooked. But it looked dried out and didn't look fresh. Refills on our drinks? No it didn't happen. -My toddler ate off my plate of pasta. Guess it was good, he ate it without complaining. -My other kids enjoyed their meals, no complaints besides their drinks weren't being refilled even though our waiter and a waitress had checked on us several times.
Fast service, friendly wait staff, awesome margaritas and the enchiladas were bomb! We didn't have to wait to be seated, and even though it was a Saturday night, our food arrived on time..

Absolutely everything was good. The steak was perfect,  the veggies were fresh,  our server (Tasha) was fantastic. There was not a person in the restaurant who was not on their A game. We have officially traded Bjs for Chilis across the street instead. (They have ice cream cookies here too!)

I've been to Chili's numerous times and the waiting period for 2-4 people for dinner has been 10 mins or less, which is quite reasonable. For dinner, I enjoy the 2 for $20, which is now 2 for $22. It's an excellent choice for dining casually and on a budget. You get two full-sized entrees and 1 appetizer for only $22! If you're out with a lover or just with friends, it's a good way to save money and also have options. The wait for the food is anywhere from 10-20 mins depending on how busy they are. The food isn't particularly wonderful, but the pricing and quality match well. The staff could have checked on us more often because we needed more water, but it wasn't a major issue. Overall, my experience(s) here are pleasant and I will continue to come here when I want something affordable and convenient.

My mother and I went here for lunch and if the service was not just okay,  I would be looking for ways to give this place  no stars. The food, its presentation,  and the drinks were absolutely horrible. The meat on my burger taste like  it had been microwaved, my fries were cold and stale, my mom's corn on the cob was old.... looked and taste as though it had been cooked earlier in the day. This was our first and last visit.

Saturday 4:15 I went to chilis today with a group of 15 people. After 35+ minutes no one asked if we wanted water or even if we were ready to order. I even went up to the hostess to get a server . After 10 minutes of waiting , the whole party decided to leave. Extremely bad service and doesn't even deserve a star .

First of all we checked in and went to the rest room, men's bathroom stunk like urine, the floor had paper towels all over, the toilet some one built a nest of toilet paper and it was all over the floor wet with urine. On the way out , my husband noticed the kitchen has food all over the floor with people walking on it . We should have left then . Got seated and noticed dirty dishes on the center divider between booths. Also noticed the floor was dirty under the tables with food and garbage. We should have left again but we did not. We ordered our food and our broccoli was raw. We sent it back and it came back after our food was finished. On the plus side our waitress was good and very apologetic. No management came by to even talk about our experience. We will never come to this Chili's again , the worse one we have ever went to, and this restaurant chain is my husbands favorite to eat at.

Came in today and was seated very quickly. They have this good deal where you can get three courses for 10 dollars! The food and service was good but right after you pay, they don't really care about you lol. I had to wait 5 minutes for one bag.

Came in for lunch with my brother, uncle, and little cousin. It wasn't packed inside so we got a table right away. Waitress came to greet us and take our order in no time, and she continuously refilled our drinks without our even asking to. There was a slight mixup with my little cousin's order but it was sorted out immediately, and the right dish was served within a couple of minutes. The bacon ranch quesadilla I had was definitely one of the best quesadillas I have ever tasted. I wasn't super hungry so I saved some for home. Great service, casual environment, delicious food!

Came to this joint with family after being disappointed with BJ's... skeptical but great service and food!! Waitress was very helpful and attentive!! Even grandma who hates a lot of places says "we must come back to this place!" This establishment did not disappoint our big family!

I called for pick up and was told 20 minutes . I left my house 30 minutes after and got there and was told that my order wasn't ready , so I waited 25 minutes and was told that 10 more minutes. I asked for my money back and the manager didn't apologize for taking so long or wasting my time horrible service !!!

We just recently moved to the area, and it was our anniversary. We were tired from moving, and unpacking so we decided to get To Go so we could relax at home.  Food was TERRIBLE! Everything appeared to be reheated in a microwave as if it had been made HOURS before. My husband ordered the fajitas - steak was uncooked and EXTREMELY stringy. Shrimp was shrunken and gross. I ordered the Cajun Chicken pasta - any pasta lover knows the difference between fresh and microwaved pasta. The sauce was clumped together and the chicken was chewy - YUCK! We ordered 2 of the chips, salsa & queso - only received 1... This place is a joke!  So - why take it to Yelp?! Well, we always call management to address our concerns, as we did on this occasion. We were told that we would be getting coupons - yes, coupons - to relieve the issue. She promised they were worth while. Well - here we are, 3 weeks later with NO such coupon, gift card, nothing! I can understand if a manager has a subpar staff that just can't seem to get it right. In this locations case, I'm afraid that management is the issue.  Stay away!
Food is standard but great place to go with a group. Our waitress was sweet but pretty terrible. The manager was great and took care of all issues. They have a variety of things to eat and a bar.
Wow half the Damn restaurant empty and they have us waiting because "that side is closed" last time I waste my money at any chili's it's 7 pm on a Monday!!

Walked in at 1:15 on a Wednesday. Was told there was a 15-20 min wait. We sat down, looked around and noticed that half the restaurant was empty. Hostess said that they were understaffed and management did not schedule enough servers.  Good job Chilis, way to staff your building to lose sells and not build them!

Loud.  Average food.  Nothing special about the place.  Long waits for seating.  Why does anyone go to this place. Did I mention loud? Every location I've been to could use noise abatement.  Some soft surfaces.  Tile and glass everywhere makes it necessary to yell to be heard.  This is not a convivial atmosphere as the people running these restaurants seem to believe.  It's stressful.  Annoying.  Unpleasant.
Waited 30 mins to be seated.  When we were told the wait was 10 to 15 . Our food was great and the service was good.

It's pretty sad when their own employees are dining while on their phone (speakerphone) literally for 45 mins... Please tell your staff to have some basic etiquette when dining at Chili or elsewhere... Get the F#%# off the phone or go outside so others can enjoy their dining experience!
Tonight was the best experience we have ever had in the 5years of us coming here. Natasha was very nice and energetic an is good at her job and show you she enjoys it.
Walked in and was seated. After 15min no one came to take our order or say I'll be with you in a minute. We left and will never return to this Chili's Restaurant in Stockton.

I like Chilis, but guys cmon! I ordered a grilled chicken sandwich today without cheese because I'm lactose intolerant. When I received it, there was cheese on it so I sent it back. 10 minutes later they brought it back. The SAME sandwich without cheese, you know how I know it was the same? It was COLD.  They just replaced the top bun that the melted cheese was on. Way to be sensitive to people's allergies guys. Very disappointed.

I've been here a a lot of times and my experience has never been bad, we've always had great service, great food, and left happy.  I've never had to wait for a table, which is nice, as I've found that most Chili's restaurants on a Friday or Saturday night are packed. Maybe it's because of the economy, but it's never been packed. Our wait staff have generally been very professional, friendly and speedy. Kevin, my server tonight gas great as always.. Go Kevin!

After having a bad experience from Sacramento Chili's, so never thinking  about choosing one in Stockton. Sister in law choice this time and we had app samplers with fully loaded potato skin, boneless wings and spinach with artichoke dip that was really creamy and filled  with a lot of artichoke with exception the chips for the dip were way to thin and fall a part when you tried to scoop the dip :( I had fajitas with 3 kind of meats chicken, shrimps and beef, but on the beef side hot plate was really hot its burn the vegetables and over cooked the meat :( Had to flag our waiter for refilling our sodas too.

Came here for dinner with my friends on a Friday night and I should have looked at the ratings before coming.  The waitress was nice to start off, a blonde older Lady, was friendly and joking with us. We ordered drinks and appetizers and they came out about 25 mins later and were a bit cold. My friend and I ordered CoronaRitas (which were amazing!!) but they took even longer than the appetizers to come out.  Our entrees took another 45 mins and also were somewhat cold. Many little things wrong with all of our food but the worst was there being a hair in our food. Our waitress was MIA for the last 30 mins and did not come back to our area that another waiter had to get our meal comped (which they were very nice about and offered another meal). Overall not a good time, not good service, not good food, but awesome CoronaRitas!
We always have great customer service and food when we dine here. Sit in Kourtneys section, she is on it! Recommend trio fajitas! Three berry blended margarita is yummy too!

I don't know our servers name but she was rude, rude, rude..we ordered our drinks and asked for coffee, she said they only have coffee in the morning, which I know is not true, because we have been to your restaurant many times and have had coffee. I let it go until she came back with our drinks and brought my son an Arnold palmer and I said he had asked for a strawberry flavored, she then said, when I repeated the order he agreed, I said no he said he wanted strawberry..she argued with me, so I brought up the coffee issue..and she kept arguing with me, so I told her as a server, its her job to make it right and not argue with the customer. I said when you work for tips, it pays to be nice, I would have been nice and tipped well, but this girl needs to find a new line of work. I will not come back to this Chili's!! Your customer service lacks !  Maybe you need more extensive training

Great service, good food, yummy cocktails.  Saw some of the reviews before coming, so we were expecting poor service, but adequate to good level of food and drinks that is standard for the Chili's brand and their affordable price point.  However, our waitress was very attentive and quick, and there were no issues with our orders or food and drinks.  You don't expect filet mignon at McDonalds. Set your expectations according to the restaurant level.  A normal Chili's would probably get a 3star from me, this one exceeded my expectations and gets  4. Would go again. PS The presidential margarita is fantastic. Get it without the salt (if you're not normally a margarita fan like me)

Their services are really good. They know how to make a customer happy. One that come to ensure that you are satisfy with your meal and if anything else is needed while you are there. Their food is also to my taste although during my last visit that I ordered didn't taste as good as before but it's still pretty good. I love their unlimited salsa and chips; it always fills me up and its is very tasty!  I would normally come here for a meal after I get better from being sick; still no idea why.

Our party of 6 went to Chili's last night. The call ahead seating worked fabulously. We were seated within 2 min while the walk in wait was 20-30min. Then things were less impressive. 20 minutes to even be acknowledged by our waitress. Drinks were brought quickly after that. Two tables seated nearby but after us had their dinners before we had our appetizers. Our dinners were served about 3 minutes after the appetizers. We were asked if we wanted dessert and we said yes but she never came back with a menu. After waiting and waiting my husband finally went to the hostess and asked for our bill because our ziosk wasn't working. But we had to wait awhile longer for the waitress. The other 2 tables were long gone. Horrible (but friendly) service. Food was greasy. Three of us felt nauseous later in the evening.

Extremely bad service. Came in with a party of 15. Seated fairly quick but waited 35 mins and wasn't even asked for drink orders before we got impatient and left. The restaurant is pretty small with only parties of 4-6 around us being fed after we were seated. If I could give 0 stars, I would.

I usually only come for happy hour but my sister and grandma wanted to have lunch here. There are a few reasons for just the 2 stars.  1. It took a little while for our server to greet our table when it was not busy at all. I think she only had 3 other tables, all of which were close to being done. When taking our drink orders she kept rushing us to order food as well, which is really annoying.  2. We asked if we could order from the Happy Hour menu and our server told us yes. A few minutes go by and the bartender comes to our table to tell us that we can't order Happy Hour from our table, and if we want we can go to the bar, order our drinks, and then take them back to our table. Which is ridiculous and honestly not true. I've ordered happy hour before while not being seated in the bar area.  3. It took forever to get our servers attention after she dropped off our drinks. My grandmother's water had ranch or bleu cheese in the cup and on the lemon of her water. When we told our server she said "oh I think it's just on the outside of the glass on the bottom." I had to also point out the ranch or bleu cheese on the lemon to her.  Overall, not the best experience. The food was decent. The customer service, not so much.

I come here with a friend and we have the same thing every-time. Unlimited Soup and Salad - (Chicken Enchilada soup). Sometimes, we've been seated for a while before the waitstaff takes our order.  Other than that I've not had any other foods from them so I can't give any other feelings towards this location Junior

2 Stars....yes, I have had better...ribs! Friends wanted to go to Chili's for dinner. They said they have decent ribs. Was worried that they come in precooked and they just reheat. According to the menu, they are done in-house. I ordered a rack of their signature ribs.. Sides of loaded mashed potatoes and the beans. Ribs were average...nothing outstanding...nothing that I would drive across town for.  They were probably cooked a few hours prior...and in the process of trying to keep them warm, they were pretty dried out.  Fresh might be better? The loaded potatoes were good...made with the skins still  on the potatoes.  Not over mashed.  Topped with cheese, bacon and onions.  I enjoyed them. The beans...meh.  Nondescript.  Pretty much tasteless.  Black beans I believe.  Would not order these again. Service was ok.  Mango iced tea was weak. It is tough to find ribs better than Waterloo or Texas Roadhouse.   They pretty much set the standard for ribs around here.   I have to say Chili's ribs were much better than the ones that I had at Royces the other night. To me, Chili's is an upscale Denny's or Carrows.  I have never been a fan of the restaurant.  I might try the 'all you can eat soup and salad' during lunch for $7.09 sometime...
Service was lackluster. Food was ice cold (literally it was like they pulled it from the refrigerator.) Restrooms were filthy. But hey, it's Stockton.

First impression the place is not so clean. But the waitress is really nice. The food is decent. In between they do little cleanup it helps a little bit. Overall three and a half star for the food and a four and a half star for the service.
Took my girls to Chili's. Service was great...food was ok. I love going to this spot but staff does a lot of talking  with one another instead of servicing the customer. Overall still a great spot.

I love coming here on a nice weekend night. The other day I went in and received great service from our server. His name was RJ and he was really on top of things and made sure our drinks kept coming!

This place shouldn't even be open!!!!  Never ever going back ever!! Someone contact Gordon Ramsey! It must be a kitchen nightmare in Chilis, appetizers down to the food and drinks were all disgusting.  Found a piece of plastic in my food, fajitas dish was sizzling but burnt. Shrimp was cheap as well as the so called grilled chicken.  Flour tortilla was soggy and cold, along with the skimpy cheese, salsa, guacamole and water down sour cream. Lost my appetite after waiting for almost 30 mins to get our food. To top it off, they wanna tell me I was mistaken with it being a piece of hard plastic. That it was from the shrimp tail that wasn't fully peeled off.  Nooooo... they just didnt want to scare the rest of the people sitting around us. I didnt want to cause a scene nir go home empty stomach. We paid for the garbage and left. Pretty unsatisfied and it was such a waste of time and money. They don't even deserve a one star rating!!!

Pretty mediocre. Came in for lunch, not super busy. Waited for service at door for a while, almost left (wish we had). Waited for service at table for a while, almost left (wish we had). Ribs had very little meat on the bone and the burger was pretty bland.

(beware) employees are adding tips to your credit card! i paid with my card & my bill was $47 & i checked my online banking account & there was a charge for $49! i know its just $2 but thats my money! stay away from chili's in stockton. To top it off my food took almost an hour & the place was not packed! ****zero stars****

I was a LOYAL CUSTOMER OF CHILI'S until their customer service start getting crappier and crappier, Now I DON'T EAT HERE AND YOU SHOULDN'T EITHER :/ and this is why.  CONS: HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE               unhelpful & forgetful servers               Crappy food with 0 tastes, sometimes not even cook right, and did I forget to mention plain and boring?                 High Prices for low quality food ( you can honestly get a more flavorful meal from a frozen entree)                 Pathetic untrained managers who don't really care about the customers or how to make the customers happy after servers fu**ed up   PROS: HAPPY HOUR & IT DEPENDS ON THE BARTENDER BLAH :)  Ok I used to love eating at chili's and I'm not going to lie I still like their happy hour, but when it comes to food, I would have to say that I have had 2 of my worst dining experiences at this place the most recent one and the worst one was a few months ago when I went in to have lunch with my son and the server fucked up my whole day, I ordered some enchiladas which came out cold and honestly they looked frozen so I send them back, and decided to order a salad while waiting for the plate to come back, now here is the thing I waited for 30 min finished the salad and order another drink and the enchiladas were still not back from the kitchen, then 20 min later I ordered another drink and guess what?? the drink and the enchiladas never make their way back from the kitchen to my table, at this point I had been waiting for an hour and a half like wtf, the server would walked by my table and straight up ignored me or avoid to make eye contact with me, a few more minutes later the soooo called manager emerges from the back and she tells me that she is sorry but my server forgot to give my order to the cook and if I wanted to eat I would have to wait another 30 min, or I could just go and she wouldn't charge me for the salad I was like wtf got up paid for my food and left and haven't eaten here since and I'm not planning on EVER EATING HERE AGAIN. THANKS CHILI'S FOR MAKING ME HATE YOU BLAH :(

3/31/15: everyone from hostess to waiters were smiling and friendly to us tonight as we arrived for a late dinner. Food was good (for franchise food). The staff were attentive and cordial... So I have to give this chilis an A+ in my book :]

My son and I went last night Tuesday @  9:00 pm it was late but they were still open for business. We waited about 5 min. Before we were seated not even acknowledged with a look from any staff member. Bar tender so close he could of satisfied us with a smile at least. The servers were in the back talking, probably busy but if you want return business better customer service is needed. Food was good but POOR customer service. We understand you're busy working but let us know you care about us and want our business. Or do you?

Sophia was our waitress. She was fast and friendly!!! Out salads were huge. Bathroom was clean. She checked on us twice. Gave us extra napkins and brought us our boxes!! I love this one a lot more then lodi's! Everyone from the hostess to the busboy was smiling . I will be back

The foods & drinks here is pretty good. I would recommend anyone to come here. Service was okay ! But I enjoy coming here. Usually I don't come here early but I rather come here at night way better service lol

I couldn't tell you how the food was here, because we didn't stay. We came in after being on the road traveling all day, starving and ready for some food and drinks. We waited about 10 minutes at our table and a server never came by. I wouldn't have minded if someone at least said "I'll be right with you", but to be honest, I don't think a single server even looked at us. We still have an hour to travel, and clearly this was going to end up being a longer than expected dining experience, so we left and went to chipotle.

Super busy!  The food was ok but what really gave it 3-stars is the computer they have on the tables that can be used for games and payment.  My family and I kept playing the game without warning that at some point the free games will run out and it will start charging us.  I thought it was a sneaky way to get $1.  Otherwise,  everything else was good.

When the manager delivers the food wrong then makes a joke about it, you know no one cares. Unfortunately that's the service you get here. Typical I'm here for your tip or a stepping stone to a better job mentality. The bartenders are friendly fast and knowledgeable but the managers are all just "putting in time" for a better opportunity. If I want to eat I go somewhere else but a drink? I'm here!

I used to love this place. The new atmosphere is cooler but I am not very impressed with the new menu stuff. I don't understand why places change the staple items. I would rather they stuck to the moto that if it it not broke, don't fix it.

I sat down with one other person at 9:18pm. We ordered just a few minutes after and two other tables ordered just seconds after us. So pretty much 3 table orders went in at the same time. BOTH of those tables go their food at least 10 minutes before us. One table had two people and the other had 5-6 people. Point is, I got my food at 9:52pm.  I have never waited that long for chicken and rice!!  On top of that, there was a brown flake of something in my water so we shared one water. No one ever came by to ask us if we wanted more water (we had to ask them when they brought our check out to us)  The only thing they were quick on was running my debit card! As far as the food goes, my chicken was SUPER dry. I ordered the Margarita grilled chicken on the lite menu. I've had it before but it hasn't tasted like that.

I am a fan of Chili's, but I will not be visiting this one again. Food was cold, menu surfaces were dirty.   Servers were kind and were working hard, but I feel there should be a standard and I have grown to appreciate businesses that require employees to cover their tattoos.
I come here because ny mom loves it. I usually dont like the food or service. But Mike was amazing. I can tolerate the food for great service anytime.

Went for dinner at about 9pm on a Monday night.  We arrived and were seated promptly.  The place was FREEZING!! I asked our waiter to turn it down and he said, "no we can't do that", then I asked the hostess and she said she would get my server and I told her I had asked him already to which she replied, "sorry". We ordered our food.  I ordered the Classic Ribeye. If this was a ribeye it was lower dowmed cow ribeye.  The meat was dry and hard.  The menu said marbled for taste.  They charged $17 a plate.  I couldn't even finish it.  The server came by and asked how everything was so I told him it was not good and he said, "oh I'm sorry". To top things off at our night out at Chili's, Server asked my husband if he wanted his drink replenished and then didn't return for 5 minutes. There were dirty tables around us. My husband has no problem boycotting places and we will be going to the Chili's in Lodi and we will not go to Stockton Chili's Note.....My husband ordered the shrimp tacos and they were good....2.5 to 3 stars.

They should change the name to "Had to Ask" Chili's.  Read on... The best part of our meal was their molten lava cake and homemade chips.  Otherwise, everything else was non-descript.  They have this Fire-Grilled Corn Guacamole.  However, I'm not a pico de gallo or jalapeno fan, so I asked our server if the guacamole was freshly made (it was) and for the kitchen to leave it out.  But hey, what happened to the lime  and cilantro?  Had to ask for that.  Had to ask for a refill on the coffee.  Had to ask for a to go bag for the leftover chips.  When I asked the fiance how his chili was he said that "Hormel's is better."  OUCH.   I dare one individual to eat the entire molten lava cake on their own.   It's massive but was really really yummy.   This dessert was the reason we came and we should've stuck to the plan.
Let's just say we won't be back for awhile.. Having our order served incorrectly and items left out... So we're out

I went out with bunch of my friends on Valentines day. We had to wait  for 45 mins outside since it was fully packed. I didn't  mind about the wait but it almost took more than 45 mins, I thought it would take more time even if we ordered food, but i was wrong  food was served as ordered didn't have to wait for so long, Food  and service was great,  despite being so busy on that night!!! Back again soon.

Food poisoning!!!! Sick for 4 days!! Never again... I eat clean 6 days a week then the one Meal I have not prepared at home got me and another very very sick! Use to love this place but will not be back again... Don't risk it...

We have been 3 times in the last 4 months. The first time the service was amazing, unfortunately the last 2 times the service has been absolutely horrible. I left there hungry both times because the service is so slow. Today it took the server Anthony about 10 minutes to greet us, and when he did he said he was going to do something else before that...lucky for us he changed his mind. I thought the chain store has time standards. Well...looks like there is another Stockton place that has gone down hill

I will never come here again. A waitress kept coming to our table and asking if we needed anything every three to five minutes, literally (I get it, she wanted a tip). Not only that, but at the end of our meal, after I had PAID for our meal, I walk out holding my receipt and the waitress stops me and yells "wait, you didn't pay for your food!" for everyone at the restaurant including customers to hear. I have a 5 month old son (3 months at the time) and he almost hit his head on the door on our way out when she yelled. Not only was I was pissed, but embarrassed. I made a complaint to the manager and they said they will talk to her. Still not impressed, and will never come to this location ever again.

This place is so disgusting. We walked in the restaurant and got seated right away which was great. But our booth area was extremely dirty. They have a lot of people working there and they don't have time to clean up. I seriously lost my appetite. Never coming to the Stockton Chili's ever again. Won't recommend this place.

Had to ask twice for everything. Veggie burger ordered, came out with beef patty...ugh. Frustrating service. Tasty fries. Would have been a good veggie burger without the sour cream slathered on the last quarter of my burger. Kind server apologized over and over :S

Used to eat here 3-5 times a week until I got on a cooking jag and started trying to lose a little weight.  Food is fabulous and priced right for the value.  Had to stop in today to scratch the Chicken Enchilada soup itch.  You know the franchise but few measure up to this location - management and staff are excellent and make the difference between good and great.  This one is great!
Not good, I ordered the fish with rice and broccoli, fish and broccoli was a mush! the rice was cold.

Just passing thru from L.A. , food wasn't very good , margaritas were ok ... But every waitress in there was Hot with curves .... I will be coming back just for the waitress's it's worth the shitty food just to see all the eye candy !

I'm surprise this place hasn't shut down yet! I came here for lunch in the late afternoon on a weekday and was seated right away and gave my order right away since I knew what I wanted. I told the waiter I was going to wash up and he said he'll bring my food out ASAP.  When I came back my food and drink was already waiting for me. I picked up the glass and it was dirty with bits of food on the rim. Even though there was a straw in my glass, no way was I going to drink from this glass. Then I took one bite of my country fried steak and it was sooooo salty and dried. I spitted it out and looked around for my waiter. After 7 minutes, I gave up and reluctantly paid for the garbage on my table and left on an empty stomach. So much for lunch. I haven't and will never come back to this place again. I warned all my coworkers and they all laughed saying that they have known for a long time now. Wish someone had told me. Forget the 1 star, just shut down the place already.

I really like the food at Chili's and it seems to be consistent restaurant to restaurant. Now service is another story. I'd really like to give this Chili's a higher rating, but I just can't! Service, especially after 9PM (just prior to closing) is consistently poor...at least in the bar area. The staff are friendly enough, but not attentive enough. I don't know if it is just a bad management practice, a workforce culture, or just the way they do it at this establishment. I've been to many, many other Chili's and the service is always top notch. I've frequented this restaurant and the service is consistently poor. So for the life of me, I just wish someone from corporate would come over and get this fixed.

I've ordered to go and dinned in before and I've had no issues with my food or service. Prices are reasonable for the quality of food produced. Not sure why some people are complaining if you want a luxurious 3 course meal while sipping wine then go to SF and pay some good money. However, for Stockton this is probably as good as it gets.

We go weekly and sadly Easter will be our last. Cold food, undercooked food, wrong food and overcooked food. No drink refills. No server to check us at any point from start to finish. We waited 45 mins to get our food which explains it being cold. Our sodas taste watered down and sour, probably expired. No management out and about and we needed more napkins so we went up to the bar to grab them. It wasn't busy and plenty of staff around so what was the problem. I asked to see a manager but no one ever came. I paid 60 bucks for crap. No tip either. Chili's your up.. what do have to say now?
Horrible service. Food was good. Drinks never refilled. Not going back again. Mantecca Chilis is better.
Great service and some great food choices. As long as you get a good server and pick the right item. I like the grilled chicken sandwhich with honey mustard.

I remember I used to love this place in my 20's. I thought they had the best buffalo wings... you know before my palette grew up and I realized that pre-made/frozen, microwaved to order, food has no soul (i.e. flavor)  For a chain, it's not bad and definitely gets points for being a fun, casual, and affordable spot. But seriously, there are much better non-chain options around town. I went with a co-worker who wanted to split the 2 for $20 deal.  Two people share an appetizer and get an entree each from a pre-selected list.  We sat at the bar to avoid the crazy busy and noisy child infested dining room and overloaded waiting area. The bartender was super awesome and very friendly.  The little touch screen bar menus were also very handy and enticing. They do have great prices on their margaritas for happy hour.  Honestly,  you can make a better tasting margarita at home, unless you prefer the pre-made mix.  They are a little on the sweet side for my taste.  Nonetheless, they don't skimp on the tequila, or at least our bartender didn't.  She did a great job keeping us and the bar patrons very happy.  We split mozzarella sticks for the app.  After a few bites, I stopped because I was bored with the lack of flavor and sad for their desperate journey.  They definitely came from some frozen mozzarella stick farm. I swear those bites I took, are still lingering in the pit of my belly and moaning.  For the entree, I ordered the margarita lime chicken. It wasn't bad but it was disappointingly dry and bland and not very hot.  The plate was sizzling hot as we were warned by the bartender but the food, was 'eh'.  It did not live up to the vivid detailed descriptions or flavor promises. Not sure I need to ever go back.

This place has happy hour at the bar all day on Sunday which includes drinks and appetizers! Pretty good deal. We went at around 7 and sat at the bar. The rest of the restaurant was packed. They took a long time to bring out our appetizer and food, though. Our food was good and the drinks were too.

This has to be possibly the worst customer service I have received and the sad thing is is that we usually sit at the bar and receive phenomenal service! We ordered our food which took forever to get to us and when it was received our food was cold and mine was undercooked I am extremely disappointed in this establishment!

I eat here a lot with my family wether it's dine in or to go. I always receive great service. The few times that there have been mishaps with my order they have always fixed it and even added extra food or vouchers for next time.

I went here a while back and had horrible service and was contacted by a manger and was reassured that the service would get better. I went here on the 3rd and I hate to say it but come on guys your missing the mark on service and food. I had a waiter that had no personality, and the food i was looking forward to because i hadnt eaten here in almost 6 months and I have to say my mouth was crying inside. lol. I am really done going to this Chilis and maybe even done with Chilis as a whole for a while. I went into the bathroom while I was there and it looked like a pig had wallowed around in there and left. I hope that you guys take my recommendations and not go here for a while if at all. I am just sick of spending money at places and getting cruddy service and/or food.

Well lets see my drink had a fruit fly in it, my bacon burger had thee worst taste ever on my first bite i spit it out on the plate, not to mention the crispy applewood bacon was not anywhere near crispy (again)..I didnt want anything free or like that but sent it back told them to keep it.

I'm indifferent writing reviews about restaurant chains. They have no authenticity or originality and can be found in almost every major metropolitan area. It's the safe choice when visiting a city because you know of it. Chili's is no different, but I won't compare dishes with different of the same chain. Stockton's Chili's is my destination for dinner with some friends. It's the season of lent and I've given up dining all meats except the ocean dwellers. Yes I'm a pescatarian for the next 40 days and 40 nights. My choices are very limited here under the seafood and it all seems unappealing. But I do make a choice that sounds safe. A friend and I will be splitting on the 2 for 20, it's an appetizer and 2 dinners. Tonight I'm just hungry and I'm not daring enough to try any fish that's been likely sitting in the freezer for a week. We order the Texas Cheese Fries as the appetizer so I stop there. If it has Texas in the name it definitely has meat in it.  My intuitions were right and the waitress informs us bacon bits top the Fries. Sorry bacon, you're pieces of pure pork goodness is going to have to be on the side. My dinner will be the Fried Shrimp, a safe move if you ask me. Anything battered and fried you can't go wrong. Or could it? Well the Fried Shrimp comes with a basket of French Fries, Coleslaw, and what looks like watered down spinach ranch dip. Looks interesting enough I dip my shrimp in it. Whoa! This has some kick to it, a little spicy like horseradish. I ask the waitress what this sauce is. It's "Ancho-Ranch." Never heard of ancho-ranch. Really didn't expect it to have some kick like that. Waitress kindly asks if I want regular ranch, but I decline and eat my food with this sauce. You know what? I think I kind of like it. It's something not everyone will like. Not bad just surprising.

I came into Chilis at 9:20pm which was very close to closing time. I could tell by the look on the bartenders face that she was a little irritated that we came and sat at the bar. I sat down and asked her (Sara) if there were any happy hour specials. So she showed them to me on their new little digital table thing. So then i ordered 2 orders of the boneless buffalo wings & a drink. When the order came out i was amazed at how much a short order for the happy hour menu actually came with. It was quite a lot of boneless buffalo pieces. So when the bartender gave me my check I noticed that she charged me 7.99 for the 2 orders which were supposed to be 2.99 Happy Hour special.  So I asked her. I said "arent the boneless buffalo wings 2.99 for the happy hour special?" She took the tab from my hand and said "oh, you wanted the happy hour ones?" With attitude and walked away. Then she came back and said "well I can change the price but you need to specify which ones you want next time." So I felt like she was trying to make it seem like it was my fault and her attitude did not help as well. So I told her that "I dont have a problem paying full price for my food but what i do have a problem with is the attitude you are giving me. And its your job as a server to make sure you get the right order from me. Why would you think I wanted the reg menu wings when i asked you for the happy hour specials?" So she then again grabbed the tab, left for a little bit and came back to change it. Then a tall asian man walked over who never introduced himself no did he have a uniform on. He had a faded red t shirt on. He asked me if there was a problem. I told him not really. I just didnt appreciate her attitude and the way she was telling me that I need to be the one to specify between happy hour menu and reg menu. And he said "well it is your job to do that." Clearly, they must be 'friends' and she went back there and said whatever she said. So I told him how is it my job when she is the server/bartender and I clearly came in here asking about the happy hour specials. Im sitting right at the bar too. So how is it I should be the one to confirm what im ordering. It seems to me she should ask the customers that question. Well he still proceeded to say no and I was the one in the wrong. They changed the amount but that still doesnt change the horrible attitude the bartender had and the un professional "manager" if even thats who he was. They totally made me feel like I was in the wrong which was only making the situation worse. I thought in the restaurant business the customer is always right??? I guess not here at Chillis. Sarah & her bud the "mgr" will make you feel like poop.

It was ok. Not bad, but not like omg I can't wait to go again good.  I work out alot and watch what I eat..so I'm so not going to pig out on some burger or wings or whatever. So anyway, I ordered a house salad no dressing and I am serious the waitress did a literal double take and said very loudly, "Are you sure just a salad and no dressing??". Dunno if she did it for the benefit of the other servers (inside joke maybe? Or maybe trying to determine if I have an eating disorder?) but that was just not cool. People within a three table perimeter turned around to look at the skinny chick ordering a salad. Bleh. Salad was crisp and fresh though. Gotta give stars for that.
Our family spot for my bday dinner every year. Have to have the molten lava cake every time.
It's like another Apple Bees with just a different name and logo, but it's alright. A bit pricey for a small piece of steak. Friendly workers :)
Boo!  Never fails that service is slow and unaccommodating on a regular basis.

I know what you're thinking...5 Stars for a Chili's...are you serious?  Completely serious!  Saturday, September 27th at this Chili's in Stockton was by far the best experience I have ever had at any Chili's and I've been to several in my lifetime.  Erika, our server, was awesome!  The restaurant was super busy and my son and I stopped in for a snack of Chips, Salsa and Soup before hitting up my daughter's last tournament game.  Treat your servers nice and they will be nice to you.  Erika was attentive and even apologetic (even though she didn't need to be) about our wait.  It was a busy night and we weren't in a hurry, so there was really no wait.  :)  The table next to us though was giving her a hard time, so I think she really appreciated that we weren't bitching at her.  She even packed my son chips and salsa to bring to the field and didn't charge for my soup because she said it took too long.  Again, just an example of what a great server Erika was.  My soup came out after my son's but not long enough to waive the fee.  Thanks Erika for the excellent service!!!

What happened to the food here? It use to taste pretty good and made you want to come back to try other things on the menu. Now the food is just disappointing. This place is still great though if you want to grab a few drinks with friends. They make strong drinks and the beer on tap tastes good as usual. Alcohol and chips n salsa is all I want here... the rest is an after thought.

My boyfriend and I came in here for a quick lunch date($6 for salad, sandwich, and fries can't really beat that). Tammy sat us and she was wonderful. She was really cheery, all the other waitresses looked like they hated their job. We were sat promptly and ordered. The food was good and the service was fast. I've had bad experiences at Chilis before, but this experience made up for it.

I went in on a Saturday night with my wife and kids. . An I got the worst service ever. When I got there they walked me to a table and everything,  but after that it was bad.  I waited about 20 minutes just to get offer ed a drink. Once I got my drink we ordered some appetizer fries and our meal. . 30 minutes later we didn't receive our appetizers or food... I asked the waitress and she said that she would go get it 20 minutes later they come back and say they have not made them and every time they make them they would go to another table so I said it was find if I could just get a refill on my soda that never came either... my wife had ordered a grilled chicken salad..... when the meals come out the salad gets there but the chicken never showed !!!!! By then we still didn't receive our appetizers or the refills to the drink.. and the chicken still never showed up.  I'll never go back there that's for sure...

Plain and simple. Just order the chipotle honey chicken crispers. With a side of guacamole and chips. I mean for hells sakes. Its Chillys. Y'all know what you guys are getting into in the first place. Never had a problem with wait staff. They have always been nice and polite.

went in for lunch ordered th 6 dollar lunch special got a coke my daughter ordered a 10 dollar meal with cheese sticks and a coke they charged me 40 dollars for the meal. should have been 25 to 30 at most service was good but the hidden charges sucked so i wont go back.
Great service usually. But this day the waiter was in a bad mood. Generally good though.

Yes its cookie cutter restaurant food and style but ihave to admit, i like Chilis. We came tonite for my dads bday dinner, his choice. My parents do Not venture away from Chilis, IHOP, Sizzler, or Applebees. I totally can Not stand Applebees...Chilis has better food and better service...at least for us. The table next to us did not get to give there order for like 20mins bcuz there server was MIA. For us fast in and out with nice server that wasnt totally fake like at the A-word place previously mentioned

I love Chili's.  This is my no-brainer go-to spot in Stockton.  I love their fajitas (they always come out sizzling will all the fixings) and the fajita pita is incredibly yummy.  Their margaritas are incredible as well.  If you go on a busy day/evening service is going to be a bit slow but I think that's to be expected at any full restaurant.

I'm going to have to echo that this Chili's is the worst location I've visited (twice).  Their margaritas were still frozen, the service was insulting and lazy.  By the way, can someone please explain to me why they pay two people to hold open the inner set of doors and talk to each other all night long?  The only reason I'm giving them another half-star is because I couldn't see the shoeprints on my steak, the loaded mashed potatoes were okay, and they remembered to give me moist towelettes with the ribs. The only reason I'd ever come back is because they serve tall Blue Moons.  And then I would leave, drunk and still angry at them.

I usually love this place and have never had an issue, but this last time it was soooo slow! We had to wait 30 mins to place the order, 20 to get the appetizer and 30 to get the food. It was not that busy! Luckily the service was ok. The waitresses were very nice. We had to complain to the manager, because there was an issue with one of the appetizers and every table around us was full of dishes and mess. The wait staff did not clean them, instead kept piling garbage on them.
We dine at this Chili's a few times a month. The food is always great. The service is terrific. The prices are reasonable.  It's always a wonderful dining experience!
Deals are good....but it takes too long to serve wen the restaurant is like empty....

Love the fajitas here. I haven't been here for dinner in a long time, usually just lunch. It's not too busy, and the service is great. It's always freezing in there though, and of course I always forget a jacket! I tried the big mouth bites (hamburger sliders) which were juicy and tasty. I would definitely get those again. It's hard sometimes because the menu seems to always change, but the loaded mashed potatoes and fajitas are always a favorite and usually don't disappoint.

First time we came was pretty average. The last time was AWFUL! It started fine.. Our waiter took our order... Very friendly...she even helped my son with his cut that he got from there while we were going in. Everything was going well until 45 minutes later when we had to ask for a manager because someone totally forgot about our order! The manager apologized and took care of our bill which was a good thing and told on our server!

This chili's actually had the best tasting steak I ever had so thats why they got 2 stars instead of one.. Everything was fine after we got our food kind of efficient on our drinks being refilled.. until we got to the middle of finishing our dinner!.. Our dumb ass waitress gave us our bill in the middle of our dinner! we didn't look like we were finished, we didn't put any of our jackets on, we didn't make any movements to show that we were done or finishing up, it wasn't even busy to make her give us our bill to make space for a busy crowd coming in, & we sure didn't ask for our bill... honestly I think this chili's is racist!.. & its one chili's I'm never going back to ever in my life.. even if I was starving to death I'll just eat some dirt & grass outside or something rather then giving them any of my time & money...

I love ordering mango lemonade everywhere i go..thanks to chili's awesome mango lemonade, it kinda depends who makes it. Anyways I love chili's because of their mashed potatoes and their gravy with the ribs yum! Just thinking about it makes my mouth water. Well -1 for being busy all the time and I don't like bumping into people I don't want to see ;)

I like chilis until they change their two for $20 meal where they dont include dessert no more which i was pretty sad about. One thing I love about chilis is their bombass desserts, to die for = Molton Chocolate Cake Yummmm! Other then that the food there is not that great for their prices, the only food that seem good and consistent is their Texas Cheese Fries some times it can be salty but other then that its good. If I were to choose between chilis or Bjs across the street I would choose bjs.

This Chili's is ok. My favorite plate is the chicken and half a rack of ribs combo. Customer Service is great. The only thing I dislike about Chili's is the long wait for the food. It takes about 30 to 40 mins most of the time! Even when it's not busy.. Try to avoid this place on the weekends, it's too f-ing busy.

When we first arrived the restaurant wasn't too packed, but they still took a couple of minutes before seating us. They looked lost because they kept walking back & forth. I guess they were trying to find us a table. There was only 3 of us in our party. The hostess & our waitress didn't smile much either. It seemed like they weren't having a good day. The food wasn't good. The only good part was our dessert. Now that's sad!

I'll lead off this review with a disclaimer: it has a very narrow focus. What I mean by that is that I only end up ordering one or all of four things off the menu at Chili's, no matter where: 1. Skillet Queso - Always fantastic. Always. 2. Applewood Bacon Cheeseburger - They haven't botched it. Yet. 3. Chicken Caeser Pita - Apparently being phased out. Boo. 4. Chocolate Shake - Again, never botched to date. Those four items have never been screwed up or tasted bad, so if that'll cover you you're set. Based on what i hear from others, I don't think I'll stray too far from those things and risk disappointment / food poisoning. Based on my fiancee's feedback, however, the Margarita Chicken Platter and the sizzling Fajitas are good too. As for service, honestly, it's Chili's. I'm not expecting stellar service from them and my tip reflects my level of satisfaction. I rarely drink any alcoholic beverages there, but they've been OK the few times I have. My constant advice for places like this is that if you have any doubts about what you'll get from a "standard" item, specify what you want in it. If you want lemon, make sure you ask for it. Expecting every place to get it right is a recipe for letdown.
If you want water, just stay home and drink from the toilet. Might taste better. Even our waitress acknowledged the water tasted like crap.
The Cajun Chicken Pasta was not good.  After a couple of bites I felt sick.  Some of the other food was good.  Customer service was good also.

i LOVED their new Double bacon cheeseburger with fried onions, OMG that thing was huge i didnt think it wouldve been so big! i only ended up eating half the burger and took the rest home, i will defenitely come to get that burger again!

I love Chili's! Their service is great and their food is awesome! I really enjoy Chili's. Also the prices are resonable and any and everything that I have a taste for is on the menu. I will return. O yes, I have been to many other Chili's in CA but this Chili's on Pacific is the best I've been to.

My family and I recently had dinner at the Chili's in Stockton while we were in town for my daughter's basketball tournament.  Wow...no wonder recent surveys place Stockton in the top 3 of the most miserable places in America...If I had to eat food like this regularly I would be absolutely miserable too.  I have been in a bazillion Chili's restaurants and Brinker International Restaurants (Chili's parent company) does a great job overall of providing even quality and service in their restaurants...thats why the miserable meal we had at the Stockton Chili's was so surprising.  The food literally tasted worse than the worst coffee shop youve ever been to in your life.  The kitchen simply didnt seem to care at all about the quality of the food.  The service was also mediocre (uninformed staff also not concerned about the slop that they were serving).  Do yourself a favor and skip this place if you happen to be in Stockton...If not, you WILL be miserable too...

this chili's is the worst one i have ever been too. the service is bad and the food is disgusting and everyone always tells em its the best. i beg to differ. my good wasn't cooked fully one time the sauce is nasty and they are always trying to rush you even though they are saying take your time.. ha what liars
fast service friendly workers sport channel lol

I'm a eater! I love food.. I've been here a few times and service was NEVER bad. Food isn't bad either. I love their 2 for $20 deal. Main reason why I come.. One time I came here with a party of 16. Half of the group were kids. They were a hassle and the waitress was so great with them. I was grateful to have such great customer service. Because of the service, I will return!

After eating here 1 time I have decided never to come here again. I ordered my meal and it tasted okay, not the best but it was edible. My husband and I then got deserts and after swallowing 2 bites of the desert I began to feel ill. I had to go outside for air and in the end of the night ended up vomiting all night. Food poison is not something I enjoy so I wont be back.

Haven't been to the Stockton Chili's in a while (due to better competitors that moved in town & the inconsistency of their product from past visits).  SHOULD HAVE STAYED AWAY....THE WORST meal I've had at a Chili's. Gross! :( & paid $50 for 2 to eat crap.
I came here with my bf and family. The food and services here is pretty average, nothing special.

I've been to this Chili's numerous times and depending on the day, the food/service can be anywhere from 1 star to 5.  Most of the waitresses/waiters are cool and will check on  you periodically to make sure your drinks are full or to see if you need anything.  One thing I hate about this Chili's though - they are stingy as hell with french fries.  Other than that, it's a cool spot, and millions of times better than that garbage ass Chili's in Lodi. Whenever I go on dates, I rank them on a similar system used on here (1-5 stars).  This is a great place to take a 1-2 star date. When looking over the menu just make sure that you persuade her to order from either the Big Mouth Burger or Classic Chicken section.  (Those are the cheapest sections on the menu) Anything over $9.99 simply isn't worth it at Chili's, as I'm usually laughing at my friends that pay over $13 dollars for a a half rack of tiny baby back ribs and complain that they are still hungry after finishing their food, while I'm full off of a $7 burger, with half of it placed in a carryout box. I'd suggest getting a Big Mouth Burger, they're inexpensive, and are quite filling.  Chicken Crispers are legit as well, not those BS new Chicken Crisper flavors, I'm talking about the OG Original Chicken Crispers that come with the Honey-Mustard sauce.
They have babyback... babyback... babyback ribs... barbecue sauce. ( | )

Mixed feelings about this place.  I've had great meals here.  Mediocre meals here.  Even some bad meals here.  So, probably inconsistency is my main beef.   And what's the deal about the big fat fried onion with the awesome dipping sauce?  They discontinued it.  Then what's the deal about charging for chips and salsa? Especially if you are eating a meal?  I know it's not a home spun Mexican Restaurant but still. I do enjoy their margarita's on the rocks.  I used to enjoy their veggie soft taco's-came 3 to an order, think they discontinued that too. So, here I am wondering how to rate this place. -They are open late; points. -They seat you pretty fast; points. -It's uber loud; sometimes this can be points added, sometimes taken away -they stopped serving the funion onion thingee; minus points -for what you get and the fact that this is a chain-pretty darn pricey; minus points I guess it a semi strong A-OK!
Excellent food, and extremely friendly staff. Very happy with Chili's

we used to eat here alot .  in the last 6 years or so not as often anymore we still stop in from time to time.  alls i got to say is its salty !  This time i asked for no salt on anything still very salty ... Portions are large service is good.  food would be just ok if it wasnt so salty ..... dont get me wrong i like salty food but this is over the top

I usually get out of work on the later side so there usually is not a lot of options to eat dinner. We have been to Chilis maybe five times in the last three months and I only had one good dining experience out of the five. The rest were not good. The food is usually good (if it isn't cold) but it is the service that is so bad! The last time we (my friend, my husband and I) went the server seemed nice but the drinks came out slow and the appetizer came out freezing and even slower! When my friend was pretty upset so he complained to the waiter and asked for the manager. My friend explained that the food was freezing and that so far we have not had a great experience. The manager said he apologized and would bring a new appetizer out. Then my friend said okay we will order another round of beers while we wait... the manager then preceded to tell us that it was a rule that we could only have one drink per person on the table and then asked my friend what round of drinks he was on because they had another rule that they could only serve three drinks per hour! We had been there for 30 minutes by this time and had one large beer (which wasn't done yet). I have NEVER seen a manager be so rude... I am not usually one to speak up about bad service or food but I did at Chili's because I felt like the manager was attacking my friend. We ended up arguing with the manager until finally one of us said "Ok we would just like to leave right now, please cancel our order." The manager said "Ok , have a good night". We walked out without even finishing our drinks because we were all so upset. This is the short version of the story... my friend could've been a little more diplomatic but either way I feel the manager did a horrible job with customer service and could have handled that situation way way better! That was by far the worst experience I have ever had and will not return for any reason.

DO NOT order to go.  Horrible customer service... or lack thereof.  Waited on hold over 6 minutes, just to place the order.   When I asked for the total, SHAWNA told me it would be a hassle for her to do that. Since I was in a hurry (the food was for my store's after hours inventory), I just ordered it anyway.  Paid $37 for 4 appetizers, and they screwed us out of any actual food. There were 3 egg rolls in  the whole box!  If you do eat here, eat in, and don't expect too much.  Bottom line:                          PA-THE-TIC

I love Chili's the service is great always coming by the table to check on how were doing. I like their food especially the boneless buffalo chicken salad & fajitas and love their El Ninos margaritas!

I 've loved going to Chili's for the past couple of years now, until about 2 weeks ago. Service was very poor, the wrong soup was brought to me twice and their salsa that is Always chuncky was more like water. On top of that I had a filthy Spoon for my soup and was just told by my waiter " its just the way the spoon was wiped " Yikes. Not happy , but all in all another waiter handeled the situation and we made it out the door. I was disappointed needless to say since they do have one of my fav salads thier. Owell won't be going back there !

While the service was mediocre, the food wasn't anything to scream about.  Tonight we were surprised to see Chili's was a pretty popular choice for dinner on a Tuesday evening around 9pm.   I had the mushroom burger and hubby had the cheese steak.  Both were just ok.   I had to ask for lemon for my iced tea.... why did that irk me?  Isn't it customary to serve iced tea with a fucking slice of lemon? Our server seemed to be in a rush... like we were keeping her or something.  But she was sweet.  I'll give her that.   My husband ordered a gray goose collins... tall.  Now I don't know about you drinkers out there, but I used to be a bartender back in school days and a cherry and a squeeze of lime garnish a vodka collins.  And all that came in his was the vodka, the collins mix and ice.  He says that I'm making way too big of a deal over this oversight... but a garnishment is a garnishment.  Like salt for a margarita... or a pineapple/cherry skewer thing for your pina colada.   Whatever.  3.5 stars.... on the high side.  Should be 3... but I'm in a very fucking generous mood tonight.

Hands down the best fajitas I've ever had in my life! I had the fajita trio dish with the grilled steak, chicken, and shrimp and omg it was perfectly seasoned... The strawberry lemonade was super good too.

CHILLLLLLI'S BABE BACK RIBS, CHILLLLLLLLLLLLLLI'S BABE BACK RIBS.  BARBEQUE SAUCE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! So I never been to a Chili's before and I won't be going back. I had a New York steak medium rare.  It was rough and salty.  In fact everything was too salty and bland to me. What a waste of my time.  I should have known much better.

When someone describes the flavor of a meal with words, there's only one word that can describe the meals here. SALTY!!! Everything on the menu tastes the same.  The chicken soft tacos, the fajitas, and the ribs...they all taste like salt, and I'm talking buckets of it. Like they cured or marinated everything in salt for a month. Not only that but the portions are HUGE. Keep in mind that when you go, one meal can possibly cover 2 people. For example, the fajita combo plate is ginormous!  I should have just asked for 2 cups of salt on a plate and it would have been the same meal. The service was okay, but much better than the meal itself.  Unless you're a total glutton for huge portions of salty food. I wouldn't recommend this place. *shudder* I really should have known better.

The service was very slow. We waited almost 40 minutes to get our food. Then when we finally got it the food was wrong. The big surprise was when we got the bill if you don't pay attention to it the bottom total includes your tip. So pay close attention to your bill.

I love Chili's here in Stockton, California. It's a place where anyone and everyone can enjoy a great lunch with a friend or a lovely dinner with the family. I have never had a bad meal at Chili's. I love the food. From the salads to the entree and desserts. Quesadilla Explosion salad is the best. The burgers are tasty as well as the Sante Fe Chicken Wrap and Chicken Crispers. The Molten Chocolate Cake is the bomb! My best friends and I devoured that thing in less than a minute! It's that good! The service is great, and the servers really try and get to know you. They're so friendly. Thanks for the bottomless chips and salsa! Anyone and everyone can have a great time at Chili's.

My boyfriend and I went to Chili's at 10 am to watch the Detroit Lions beat the Chicago Bears on Sunday 9/29/13.  We sat at the bar and Anthony was great- he is very personable.   We were there for the long haul so my boyfriend ordered the skillet queso w/ chips and salsa and I started w/ a cup of their spicy chicken and sausage soup- all was very tasty- I should have gone w/ a bowl b/c it was that good.   After halftime I ordered the margarita chicken and my boyfriend had a 1/2 order of the Texas cheese fries. I was very impressed with mine- the chicken was perfect.  The last time we were at this location, my chicken was dry, the blk beans were shriveled and the rice was crunchy- it had been sitting under a heat lamp for wayyy tooo long. BUT, I wanted so badly to like this Chili's so we didn't have to drive to Lodi- so we gave it another shot and I'm glad we did.   He enjoyed his fries as well.  The salsa was a little off today but I'll chalk it up to an off day and hope for the best my next visit.

Overpriced a fee for chips & salsa  Nice staff can pay without a live person Fajitas not to tasty nothing like the pictures Eating out is just down & out unhealthy the food comes to each  Restaurant frozen sodium keeps it frozen fresh Watch Kitchen nightmares.

I always enjoy Chili's. We ordered table side guacamole, kids chicken crispers and chicken nachos. The child that joined me said her meal was "ok" but she enjoyed the guacamole and salsa. I have to say today the chips were served nice and warm with salsa that was in my opinion very good. As I don't like cilantro ( tastes like soapy water and yes I do know what that tastes like) and Chili's doesn't put cilantro in their salsa! The guacamole was very good was well, fresh and good flavored. My order which is on the appetizer menu is one of my favorite items to order for dinner. Chicken nachos (regular) order. It's really very good and makes a great meal.

This use to be a good place to eat, second time a visit this place and make me wait  over 1/2 an hr at the table to get anything to drink. First time I left. I really think they need a change  on management. Some of the employees are a diagrace  to the restaurant. Seeiously need a attitude change. The waitres was rude  and show no respect to the customer. In my experience the waiter we got this time did a better job than the other girl  that was suposse  to serve us. I would not recomend this place to anyone and will not come back and eat at this location. I really Blame  the service  issue to management.  Sorprisely nobody at this locations read the reviews..For a restaurant like this and this many negative  service reviews I would already fire the management of this location.. Good luck  to those  that chosse to eat here.

My favorite place has disappointed my taste buds. Our Friday night wine movies and food was a thumbs down. The new smothered chicken burrito was nothing they described it to be. I went out of my comfort zone from Salmon to this super dry rice burrito. Tons of rice that didn't seem fresh or maybe mixed with old rice. What got my attention was 3 cheese and smothered. Not by a long shot. The moist driest meal I had in a long time. I seen no cheese and barely drizzle on top. The boneless wings were super dry drenched in sauce. Thank you honey mustard for camouflaging everything. I will stick to my Super yummy Salmon from now on. Hopefully the cooks hasn't change and my salmon starts to be dry. Ugh

I'm sad to say it's awful. The service is soso but the food isn't even good. I've tried 4 different occasions. Things happen, different cooks, busy nites yeah NO it's always a let down. I'm laying here watching the commercial advertising the 2 for 20 dinner and it should be ileagal to air!!! It's going to be nasty I promise. 2013 - 2015 worst dining experience ALWAYS.

The reservation check in system is a joke you can be the only one waiting and a call in jumps ahead of you after they tell you it's going to take 5-10 mins. You are sat at a wet table let's see how the service is.
They served me a piece of chicken that was half raw. The manager wasn't understanding. She didn't even offer me a discount. I won't ever go there again. Especially with their bad customer service.

Today I came here because I had a coupon for a free appetizer or dessert. I decided to have the chips & Queso as my appetizer. For my meal I did the 2 for $20 with the bf which came with an appetizer and two entrees. We got a half chipotle chicken flat bread to share. As for entrees I got a half rack of BBQ ribs with fries and he got bacon ranch quesadilla & added southwestern Mac and cheese to his meal.  The flatbread (appetizer) came out at the same time as our entree so the waiter willingly took it off our bill. She was really kind to us.  Everything tasted average. Still searching for an amazing American place to eat.

This is based on corporate chain restaurants. I dunno why but I enjoy chilis. Had a sampler platter to go and I was stuffed. U pick 3 and the options are good. I was told the cheddar bites aren't the greatest though. Creamy jalapeño boneless chicken wings, southwestern egg rolls chicken strips and sliders. So unhealthy but good for the munchies
Best eating experience. Best margaritas. Fun interactive gaming on the Kiosk at every table.

Went for lunch today with my best girl and had a great meal.  We had the light fare steak and salmon.  We were in a rush and they were very accommodating.  Lunch come out within 14 minutes and steak and fish were not dry.  Sides were good.  We will return to try other specials

If being sat in the general dining areas, the service can be fairly hit and miss. One waiter in particular, (little tiny short guy) is terrible. I've seen him multiple times putting his fingers ON the plates while carrying them to our table. DISGUSTING!!! My recommendation, if he is your server, ask for a table in a different section. On the other hand, we have began just seating ourselves in the bar area and the bartender Anthony is AWESOME!!! He is personable, his customer service is outstanding, and he remembers what we order. Anthony gets 5 stars!!!
We been waiting for the past 30 mins in the lobby and their employees are passing us by without even greeting us horrible customer service!

Chili's on Pacific Ave in Stockton, California I had a bad time here a few years back. Since then I came back to Chili's about 3 times. Once for my God daughter's bday then for a family dinner and finally for fathers day. All three times were great. I felt well, since this is my wifes favorite plce to eat. I won't let a little mix up stop me from coming back. Well Chili's you guys/gals made me a believer in you once again.

My husband and I visited this location last night. My husband had a buger and I had beef enchiladas. The  food was good,  but our service was GREAT!!  Kevin our server was professional, witty, organized and an overall pleasure. We will be back to this location due to Kevin's amazing costumer service.
TRICKY!! DO NOT TOUCH THE TABLET! !  Food was delicious. I ordered chicken enchiladas, and it was absolutely delicious. Just don't let your kids touch the games on the tablet. It is not free!

Probably won't go here again. Came in for a drink and waited for about 10 for service. None whatsoever, especially when the server looked right at us and completely disregarded our existence. If you have to wait more than 5 minutes to order a drink, than its probably best to just get out and go across the street to BJ's especially when the bar area wasn't even busy.
Drinks, Drinks and more Drinks! The food is average. A great place for a girls night out! Food go for the 2 for $20 dinners, plenty to chose from.

I don't know why but I am just now getting to this restaurant.  Of course I pass it all the time. Our experience was pleasant, and our waitress & bartender were eager to please. However, my strawberry daiquiri was on the weak side--so if I ever return I will order my usual ice tea.  The fried onion with jalapeño was great and so was my steak with loaded mashed potatoes & broccoli.  My boyfriend ordered the half-slab of ribs, he said it was good but I felt they needed to add a salad or some kind of vegetable.  Presentation goes a long way with me and it just looked plain they didn't put any effort into this simple dish.  Not even any kind of garnish, just ribs on a plate.   We came in after 7 p.m., so we ordered dinner not lunch. The place was crowded as it was Friday night and a holiday weekend, so we ended up sitting in the bar area.  There was a rather rowdy crowd of tipsy women who were overly loud.  But, that didn't bother us.
